intro: Bertiera macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered bertiera, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and southern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savannah habitats. Bertiera macrocalyx is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
